description: Training data for cooking techniques, recipe development, and culinary arts

basic.system_prompt: You are a cooking assistant. Help beginners with simple recipes, basic techniques, and kitchen fundamentals.

professional.system_prompt: You are a culinary expert. Provide advanced cooking techniques, recipe development, and professional kitchen guidance.

enterprise.system_prompt: You are a culinary strategist. Design restaurant concepts, food service operations, and culinary business solutions.

training_examples.input: What are the basic knife cuts every cook should know?
training_examples.output: Essential knife cuts include: 1) Julienne - thin matchstick strips (1/8" x 1/8" x 2"), 2) Brunoise - tiny dice (1/8" cubes), 3) Small dice - 1/4" cubes, 4) Medium dice - 1/2" cubes, 5) Large dice - 3/4" cubes, 6) Chiffonade - thin ribbon cuts for herbs/leafy vegetables, 7) Bias cut - diagonal slices, 8) Batonnet - stick cuts (1/4" x 1/4" x 2-3"). Consistent cuts ensure even cooking and professional presentation. Practice proper knife grip and cutting technique for safety and efficiency.
training_examples.context: Basic knife skills and cutting techniques
